entry.title: Open to all developers: Building the Future of Enterprise AI with SAP Build
entry.content:
We are very excited to share with you a recap of some of the highlights that were announced and shown at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025.

In a nutshell, we are reaffirming our commitment to developers ‚Äî and to openness. Open to the developer tools your teams already use. Open to the systems you already have. And open to helping you bring AI innovation into the enterprise securely and at scale.

With the latest updates to Joule Studio, and the developer and business user experiences in SAP Build, SAP is giving developers more flexibility, interoperability, and a better AI-powered experience in driving Application Development, Process Automation and Agent building.  Whether you‚Äôre building in Visual Studio Code, extending ABAP, creating Agents, or integrating with third-party applications, SAP is meeting you where you are.

Open to the Developer Tools Your Teams Already Use

At SAP TechEd 2025, we demonstrated that we are bringing enhancements to SAP Build that open new opportunities for developers to build, extend, and deploy enterprise-ready applications faster and more intelligently.

Over the past months, we‚Äôve laid out the foundation: We announced at SAPPHIRE this year that we will provide developers with the tools to create AI Agents with Joule Studio. With the availability of  MCP Servers (Model Context Protocol) , developers can build faster and deploy their apps more easily on BTP.

This means your preferred agentic AI development tools, such as OpenAI Codex, Windsurf, Cursor, Cline, Claude Code, and more, can now connect to our local MCP servers. They can produce reliable and accurate code using SAP frameworks like CAP, Fiori, Mobile, UI5 and others. And within Visual Studio Code, you can now access SAP Build‚Äôs productivity capabilities directly - creating UIs to define and view data models with ease. Looking ahead, we will extend this further through the Open VSX registry, bringing the same experience to Visual Studio Code ‚Äìbased IDEs like Cursor, Windsurf, and others.

Build AI Agents Natively with Low Code in Joule Studio

As enterprise applications evolve, developers need intelligent components that can reason, act, and collaborate autonomously. That‚Äôs where the new Agent Builder in SAP Build‚Äôs Joule Studio comes in.

Design, Deploy, and Manage AI Agents End-to-End

SAP Build‚Äôs Joule Studio provides a complete environment for designing, deploying, and managing enterprise-grade AI agents. It allows agents to access business data securely, automate workflows, and integrate across SAP and non-SAP systems ‚Äì all with no-code simplicity and a Vibe Coding approach using Joule to specify and build the agents.

Adding to the existing experience of Joule Studio of building agent skills, we are extending the Agent Builder capabilities further with key features like:

  • MCP Integration: The Model Context Protocol enables agents to communicate seamlessly with external tools and APIs, bridging SAP‚Äôs enterprise systems with the open ecosystems.
  • Agent-to-Agent Collaboration (A2A): Build multi-agent environments where agents can collaborate to solve complex tasks ‚Äî like finance agents reconciling transactions based on insights from supply chain agents.
  • Intent-based Development: The new Vibe Coding approach combines prompt-based logic design, visual flow orchestration, and system-triggered automation. Developers can define agent behavior in natural language, see logic visually, and deploy instantly.

Joule Studio provides the governance, lifecycle control, and scalability enterprises require, without compromising openness or developer autonomy.

Build with what you know

Developers can now run local MCP servers, allowing full agentic development, testing, and orchestration within their preferred agentic AI assistants. We have provided MCPs for CAP, Fiori, UI5 and Mobile and will soon include ABAP.

With this, SAP is expanding the SAP Build ecosystem with an open approach that meets developers where they are. SAP Build‚Äôs local MCP servers enable agentic development with developers‚Äô preferred AI coding tools, while ensuring enterprise-grade governance and clean-core compliance. With the SAP Build Full Stack Extension Package and the Service Catalog Extension for Visual Studio Code, developers can seamlessly extend SAP Build‚Äôs tooling‚Äîcombining intuitive graphical design with hands-on coding in VS Code.

In addition, VS Code support for AI-assisted ABAP development is coming soon. Inside VS Code, developers will be able to:

  • Generate boilerplate ABAP code and test cases.
  • Optimize CDS views and performance-critical logic.
  • Enforce clean core best practices and architecture standards.

Bringing AI to Your Digital Workspaces

Joule, SAP‚Äôs generative AI assistant, is now integrated into SAP Build Work Zone standard and advanced  editions, SAP Start, and SAP Mobile Start.  Integrating Joule into SAP Build Work Zone brings a unique value to users by effortlessly connecting data from multiple backend systems into a single interface. By providing answers and insights from any supported system, Joule eliminates the need to switch between tools. This empowers every business user to stay informed with all relevant information and applications in one place, their central entry point.

More than that, with embedded Joule, teams can generate comments, create workspace content, and summarize documents in seconds. Collaboration gets quicker. Work stays focused.

Joule ensures every AI interaction adheres to enterprise security standards‚Äîand now delivers this through role-based document grounding. Responses are dynamically restricted to each user‚Äôs authorization level, safeguarding data privacy and compliance across departments and industries.

Simplifying SAP Build Licensing and Packaging

Innovation should never be gated by complexity. SAP has simplified how developers and partners access and extend the SAP Build and Joule ecosystems.

Developers can now build and ship ABAP extensions that are cloud-ready, upgrade-stable add-ons for SAP BTP. These add-ons are designed to maintain compatibility across SAP versions and releases ‚Äî reducing maintenance overhead while ensuring enterprise reliability.

Access to SAP Build including Joule Studio and Joule for Developer is included in S/4HANA Cloud ERP Private Edition and the new Business Suite Packages.

Licensing options are available via Subscription, BTPEA, and CPEA models.

Partners can obtain free SAP Build licenses through the SAP Build TDD license, supporting innovation and rapid prototyping across the ecosystem.

Empowering developers in the AI-Native, Open Development Ecosystem

SAP Build‚Äôs commitment to openness goes beyond interoperability ‚Äî it‚Äôs about empowering developersto innovate with the tools, languages, and architectures they already know.

Here‚Äôs what that looks like in practice:

  • Build in VS Code with SAP extensions and local MCP servers.
  • Develop in ABAP with AI-powered assistance and visual CDS modeling.
  • Design and deploy AI agents in Joule Studio that connect across SAP and non-SAP landscapes.
  • Integrate Joule into your central entry point to reach across your SAP ecosystem.

It‚Äôs a unified environment where AI, development, and enterprise-grade governance converge ‚Äî ensuring every innovation is production-ready from day one.

Upcoming Events

Join us at these upcoming events to dive deeper into SAP Build, learn from experts, and continue building your skills.

  • Mastering SAP  -  International Convention Centre Sydney - November 12 ‚Äì 14, 2025
    Learn more: https://www.masteringsap.events/collaborate-sap-teched-on-tour

  • SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore - Bangalore International Exhibition Centre - November 25 ‚Äì 26, 2025
    Learn more: https://url.sap/qj9ygw
  • Get certified at SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore: Attendees in Bangalore can take a free onsite certification exam. You can choose one of the following two certifications: SAP Generative AI Developer or SAP Build Developer.
    Secure your exam spot: https://sap.to/60417B4rT 
    Access the learning zone:     https://sap.to/60437B4rV
  • Webcast: SAP TechEd Takeaways: Unlocking Agentic AI with Joule Studio in SAP Build - December 9, 2025
    Register now: https://url.sap/kwd4ll

Get Started: Build, Extend, and Collaborate

Ready to explore the future of AI-native development?

  • Try the new Agent Builder in Joule Studio on SAP BTP.
  • Install the SAP Build Full-Stack Extension Pack for Visual Studio Code and the SAP Service Catalog for Visual Studio Code.
  • Explore AI-assisted ABAP development and graphical CDS modeling in your environment.
  • Connect with the SAP Developer Community to share agent templates, coding workflows, and best practices.

üëâStart building today ‚Äî because the future of enterprise AI is open, collaborative, and powered by you.

entry.title: Unleashing the Power of Trusted Data: SAP 2025 TechEd Announces Enhanced Data Product Capabilities
entry.content:
SAP TechEd 2025 has unveiled advancements in SAP Business Data Cloud, and they're set to transform how data stewards and data owners manage and utilize data. These innovations empower developers and data teams to create, share, and manage custom data products, propelling analytics, AI, and operational use cases to new heights.

Data Products: The Future of Business Data

Data products from SAP are designed to convert curated and certified data, metadata, and business semantics from SAP sources into reusable, governed assets. They are fundamental components of SAP Business Data Cloud and its suite of intelligent applications, offering a seamless blend of governance and utility.

SAP's latest enhancements enable the creation of custom data products - across SAP and third-party sources - that can be shared across various analytics, AI, and operational applications. This interoperability ensures that organizations can leverage their data more effectively, driving smarter decisions and optimizing workflows.

Introducing the Data Product Studio

One of the most exciting announcements from SAP TechEd is the new Data Product Studio (general availability planned for H1 2026). This cutting-edge capability within SAP Business Data Cloud provides developers and data teams with a comprehensive visual workspace to model, configure, and manage custom data products.

 Here's what the Data Product Studio will bring to the table:

  • Visual Configuration: Craft custom data products using robust metadata from the data catalog.
  • Schema Definition: Define schemas, lineage, and transformation logic to ensure data integrity.
  • Versioning and Governance: Manage versioning and enforce governance standards through a shared domain catalog, ensuring data reliability and compliance.
  • SQL-Based Transformations: Utilize familiar SQL-based transformations to enrich and customize data products effectively.
  • Full Lifecycle Management: Oversee the entire lifecycle of data products within a structured environment, maintaining governance and performance.

Why This Matters to Data Stewards and Owners

For data stewards and owners, these advancements mean enhanced control over data assets, ensuring they are trustworthy, scalable, and reusable across the organization. The Data Product Studio accelerates the process of data modeling and transformation, making it simpler to align data management with business objectives.

SAP's latest innovations in SAP Business Data Cloud and the introduction of the Data Product Studio mark a significant leap forward in data management. By providing a structured and governance-focused environment, SAP enables businesses to unlock the full potential of their data. Stay ahead of the curve by embracing these advancements and elevating your data stewardship practices.

Looking to learn more about SAP Business Data Cloud...

  • Visit SAP Business Data Cloud on sap.com
  • Watch SAP Virtual TechEd Sessions replays:
    • SAP Business Data Cloud: Strategy, architecture, and vision (ST107v) 
    • SAP Business Data Cloud solution road map (DA806v) 
  • View the H2 2025 SAP Innovation Guide

entry.title: SAP TechED 2025 in Berlin - a new high!
entry.content:
Injured but thriving nevertheless

 

Coming back from SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin, I found myself being wheelchaired out of Zaventem Airport in Belgium. My inflamed Achilles tendon had worsened over the course of the event.

I probably should have been resting, but I was determined to be there. Between participating in the DemoJam finals, giving a presentation, meeting with SAP leadership through the SAP Mentors program, and reconnecting with so many community members, SAP Champions, and fellow Mentors, missing it simply wasn‚Äôt an option.

By the end, I could barely walk. I managed to push through for a few days, but eventually my body said, ‚Äúenough is enough,‚Äù and it quite literally shut down on the last day of SAP TechEd.

Even at what could be seen as a low point, I couldn‚Äôt stop smiling because the experience, the people, and the inspiration made it all worth it.

Caretakers

A huge thank you to Raf B. for wheeling me out of the airport, and to Jana de Klerk for taking such great care of me throughout the event. From fetching ice to taking me to the medical post at SAP TechEd. Also, sincere thanks to J√©r√©my Coppey and Wouter Lemaire for all their help and for carrying my things around when I couldn‚Äôt.

I‚Äôm truly grateful for the amazing friends I have and for all the support they gave me when I needed it most.

SAP TechED DemoJam 2025 winners

 

One of the absolute highlights for me and a new all-time high was winning the SAP DemoJam 2025 final at SAP TechEd in Berlin.

Wouter and I had a blast presenting our use case. Our goal was to show that developing with the latest SAP technologies and sharing what we build can be great fun. We both love the community spirit and feel proud to be an active part of it.

Our demo was based on a real Artificial Intelligence use case for Infrabel (Belgium), powered by a wide range of SAP technologies behind the scenes. The idea came from automating some of my own recurring system monitoring tasks. In other words, turning a practical challenge into an innovative solution.

To make it engaging, we turned it into a friendly battle: I performed the tasks the ‚Äúold-fashioned‚Äù way, while Wouter used the AI-driven application we had built. With a touch of humor and a lot of energy, we managed to deliver a DemoJam that truly resonated with the audience: blending lighthearted banter with serious SAP innovation.

Team efforts

We‚Äôd like to thank our customer Infrabel for the opportunity to work with the latest SAP technologies. A special thanks to Kevin Verzele and to everyone in the team who supported us among others, Brieuc Bernard and Tom Van de Velde . Thank you all!

The trophy will be placed at the customer‚Äôs site as a token of appreciation, symbolizing that this achievement was truly a team effort.

Working on the MCP server application

We had some fascinating discussions with SAP and Microsoft during SAP TechEd about our Artificial Intelligence journey. Specifically around using MCP with SAP S/4HANA data. These conversations sparked fresh ideas and inspired us to push the boundaries of what‚Äôs currently possible. Needless to say, we spent at least one evening in our Airbnb apartment exploring those new possibilities even further.

I'll give you a quick example of a pump comparison. The product has been fetched from actual SAP product data and is then compared against other pumps by combining SAP S/4 HANA data with online data. This is just a quick showcase snippet. I'll write up another article to detail this out further.

 

There was a lot of "MCP" visible on architectural slides and announcements in terms of support for MCP and in terms of SAP making use of MCP which showed that MCP is the new kid on the block and the "hotness" right now when it comes to Artificial Intelligence.

SAP Mentors

 

The SAP Mentor program has, without a doubt, had a profound impact on my professional journey. It continues to be a tremendous source of inspiration. Surrounded by so many brilliant minds and remarkable individuals, I always feel that I‚Äôm growing, learning, and thriving whenever we come together.

We had really productive discussions with SAP. The kind that keep them on their toes and occasionally challenge their thinking. The goal is to provide an outside perspective that helps SAP continue to improve and evolve.

We very much appreciate the time taken by everyone who meets up with us at these conferences and the candid conversations we have with them.

The vision of SAP

 

In my view, SAP‚Äôs technological vision remains truly impressive. Of course, there are still challenges to overcome but that‚Äôs true for every player in the enterprise software space. The current limitations of Artificial Intelligence affect the entire industry.

What sets SAP apart is its bold vision and determination to execute on it. They‚Äôre not just adopting what already exists; they‚Äôre actively thinking ahead, exploring how to push the boundaries of what AI can achieve in the context of enterprise software.

We‚Äôre already in active discussions with SAP on how we can push the needle even further together.

Announcements and demo's

 

While I truly appreciate SAP‚Äôs vision and the technological drive that continues to push boundaries, my heart really jumps for joy when I see live demos on stage. Even if they would fail, I prefer them because they show what‚Äôs possible right now.

Yes, Artificial Intelligence still has its limitations, but it‚Äôs incredible to see how much can already be achieved today and how quickly technology continues to evolve.

Inspired and fuelled up

These events are rocket fuel for me. They ignite something that makes me want to push harder and reach further. The inspiration hits so powerfully that here I am, writing on a Saturday night at 9:30 PM, unable to wait.

It's like hearing that one song that gives you chills and completely shifts your state of mind.

I'm back, and I've already spun up a fresh repository to experiment with new ideas and push boundaries. I'm diving deeper into Artificial Intelligence because I genuinely believe we're standing at the beginning of a transformative journey that will propel technology to heights most can't yet imagine in the months ahead.

See you at SAP TechEd 2026! Something tells me we'll have a lot more to talk about by then.

entry.title: Berlin, SAP TechED 2025 and the superheroes without capes
entry.content:
Who, at least once in their life, hasn‚Äôt wished to meet a superhero? Well‚Ä¶ it happened to me.
And the incredible part? I didn‚Äôt meet just one, but many. 

Developer Advocates

This is the story of my journey to Berlin,  an adventure that changed me, moved me, reminded me who I am.
This is the story of my SAP TechEd 2025.

It all began months ago, when I received the news: I had won a ticket. I still remember that moment. A mix of disbelief and pure joy.
My heart racing. ‚ÄúThis can‚Äôt be real‚Ä¶‚Äù I thought. But it was. Beautifully, unexpectedly real.

I was so happy I started counting the days like a child waiting for Christmas.

But life, sometimes, has other plans.
Over the last months I went through difficult moments, the kind that drain your energy and steal your voice. Family struggles that made everything heavier. 

 

 

 

For a while, I was certain I wouldn‚Äôt make it. That I would have to let that dream slip away.

Until a month ago, I kept thinking: I won‚Äôt be able to go. Then something inside me whispered: Try. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

And here I am. 

 

 

 

 

 

I told you about superheroes‚Ä¶Because honestly, what else should I call them? @qmacro @RichHeilman @thomas_jung @OlgaDolinskaja @Vitaliy-R  Some of them I‚Äôve been following in the SAP Community for 20 years.


Like a kid with posters of their idols on the bedroom wall.
If I love my job today, a big part of it is thanks to them. They inspired me, even from afar. Their passion, their knowledge, their generosity, all seeds that grew into my own path.

And when you finally meet them in person‚Ä¶ you feel small. Really small. Like an ant standing near kind giants. üòç

A special mention also goes to my beloved ABAP.  Someone said it would disappear, end up forgotten like a language from the past‚Ä¶Meanwhile, it simply smiled and proved everyone wrong.
It‚Äôs still here. More powerful than ever.

And being able to use it in a modern environment like Visual Studio Code? Pure excitement for every developer heart that still beats for code. 

Berlin was breathing the future. Artificial Intelligence everywhere,  but not abstract, not distant.
Real. Tangible. Finally programmable.

With Joule Agents and SAP Build, we can create smart automations directly from our development environment. 

 

And that was my biggest spark: AI is no longer an experiment. 

It‚Äôs no longer ‚Äúsomewhere in the future.‚Äù It‚Äôs here.
It‚Äôs in our hands as developers, ready to turn ideas into real solutions. 

And for those of us who build software every day, that means only one thing: limitless possibilities.

 

 

 

But the best part was the people. The real ones.
The ones you‚Äôve known for years through comments, chats, usernames‚Ä¶ and finally get to hug in person.

Like my friend @moshenaveh , whom I finally met face to face. üòä 
And the incredible energy of @david_ruizb , the kindness of @MariettaLopez , the smiles of @Sandra_Solis  , @lauraschmitz , @StephanieMarley @MustafaBensan ‚Ä¶ and so many others.

People who look at you and make you feel part of something bigger. A family you didn‚Äôt even know you had, until you find yourself inside it. I came back from Berlin different. More teary-eyed than photographed. More inspired than organized. With this growing desire to create, share, build‚Ä¶ and hopefully inspire others, the way they inspired me.

Because I finally realized this:

Superheroes don‚Äôt fly.
They don‚Äôt wear capes.
They don‚Äôt have magic powers.

At least‚Ä¶ not the kind we imagine.  Real superheroes are the ones who light a spark in your eyes and make you say: 

‚ÄúIf you believe in it, you can do it.‚Äù

entry.title: Top 10 takeaways #SAPTeched 2025
entry.content:
1. The "App-Data-AI" Flywheel is the Core Strategy: SAP has unified its entire strategy under a single "App-Data-AI flywheel" concept. This isn't just new marketing; it‚Äôs a fundamental organizing principle.

The idea is that best-in-class applications (like S/4HANA, SuccessFactors) own business critical transactional data that are key to running the day-to-day of a business. For Insights, The data they generate is leveraged via a harmonized, managed, and governed data layer - the SAP Business Data Cloud.  This clean, context-rich data then powers the new world of AI, which in turn makes the applications smarter.

SAP BTP is the engine for this flywheel, acting as the AI native foundation. This model explains why SAP is so focused on things like data connectivity and new models, that are essential for making this flywheel spin with exponential value.

Teched 1_Apps Data AI

 

 

2. SAP‚Äôs Big Bet: RPT-1, a Foundation Model for Structured Data: In what was arguably the biggest technical reveal, SAP announced SAP RPT-1 (Relational Pre-trained Transformer Model-1), it's first foundation model built specifically for structured, tabular business data.

This is a massive deal.

LLMs are great for text based language, but most business data lives in tables. Until now, solving predictive tasks (like "will this customer churn?") required a specific algorithm. For each different use case, thence you need to training hundreds of "narrow AI models."

The Promise of RPT-1 is that it is trained to act like an LLM for this types of questions to be answered on tabular data types. From test, it already outperforms typical text based large language models.

The demo of auto-completing a sales order line item was shown, as an example.

This tabular prediction, LLM style, can solve several classic prediction problems, all using one pre-trained model. This is SAP leveraging its core strength in structured data to build a new class of AI. 

Teched 2_SAP RPT-1

 

 

3. The Developer Experience: Open, Agentic, and in VS Code: The loudest applause of the day was reserved for the developers experience. 

SAP is making more open it's ABAP programming language and the fine tuned model (SAP-ABAP-1) to one's own preferred Integrated development environment (IDE), include tools actively adopting Vibe coding capabilities including Cline, Windsurf and Cursor among others. 

Teched 3_Open, Agentic and in VS Code

 

 

4. The Agentic Enterprise: From Build to Management: SAP is rolling out a comprehensive strategy for Agentic AI, from shipping out-of-the-box agents (Joule Agents) to capabilities of building custom agents with Agent Builder in Joule Studio to standardizing on rapidly adopted Agentic protocols including MCP (Model Context Protocol) and A2A (Agent to Agent Protocol).

In addition, to manage this new Agentic "workforce," the strategy connects to the Business Transformation Suite: the SAP Lean IX Agent Hub provides governance, and agent mining in SAP Signavio will trace and measure their business impact.

Teched 4_ Agentic AI

 

 

 

5. The Data Fabric Gets a boost: BDC now Connects to Snowflake: SAP is aggressively expanding its openness to the data front, adding Snowflake to the SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) and announcing SAP Snowflake as a native solution extension.

This is a direct response to what joint customers have been asking for. The BDC Connect program, which already includes Databricks and Google Cloud, enables "secure zero-copy sharing." This means customers can bring their SAP data products directly to their existing data platforms without costly and complex data movement. The "SAP Snowflake Extension" takes this even further, bringing Snowflake's capabilities natively into the BDC. This pragmatic, open approach is critical for making the App-Data-AI flywheel a reality in heterogeneous customer landscapes.

Teched 5 SAP Snowflake Solution Extension

 

 

6. HANA Cloud, The AI-Native Database: SAP HANA Cloud is "the database AI was looking for,": I have to say, there was a great amount of love and vibes when this was mentioned on stage about HANA. For those not fully versed on HANA's history as a new columnar DB pioneered by Hasso Platner and Vishal Sikka - this is worthy addition to it history. 

The latest upgrade to HANA is that it now has Agentic capabilities and a massive performance boost!! what a story. 

Michael Ameling‚Äôs session highlighted that HANA is no longer just a fast in-memory database; it's a multi-modal database built for the AI era. The Knowledge Graph engine is now three times faster. But the real news is the introduction of agents inside the database. New "discovery agents" will help find data objects, and "agentic memory in HANA Cloud" will allow AI agents to "persist context across long-running sessions," enabling them to learn and remember. This makes HANA the intelligent, context-aware heart of the data layer.

Teched 6_HANA Cloud

 

 

7. Beyond the Hype: 'Benchmark Engineering' for AI: Philip Herzig introduced "benchmark engineering," a new toolset in AI Foundation to move AI from "vibe checking" to a true engineering discipline.

This is one of the most practical and important announcements for developers. Everyone struggles with "prompt engineering" and model unreliability. SAP is delivering a solution. The new suite includes an "Eval service" to test use cases across models, a "Prompt optimizer" (now GA) to automatically convert and improve prompts, a "Prompt registry," and "Model fallback." This is an "all you need tool set" that finally gives developers the rigorous controls they need to build and maintain enterprise-grade AI applications.

Teched 7_ Benchmark Engineering

 

 

8. Data Products Studio - The 'How' for the Data Fabric: If "BDC Connect" is about sharing data, the new "Data Products Studio" is about creating it. This new tool within Business Data Cloud allows data teams to visually model new data products, blend SAP and non-SAP data, and govern them in a shared domain-based catalog. This is the practical "how-to" for building the data fabric, giving teams the control to create the reusable, AI-ready data products that the rest of the new agentic platform will consume.

Teched 8_SAP Data Product Studio

 

9. Physical AI: Joule Agents Get Embodied: in a "one more thing" moment, Philip Herzig demonstrated the next frontier: bringing Joule Agents into the physical world through partnerships with robotics companies.

By using the new agentic protocols, Joule agents can now orchestrate physical robots. The demo showed a Joule agent delegating a warehouse picking task in EWM to a humanoid robot, which then identified a defective item and, with Joule's help, resolved the issue according to the business process. 

Teched 9_Physical AI

 

10. The Quantum Leap: SAP Primes for the Next Compute Era: While still on the horizon, SAP announced it is making huge leaps in quantum computing, focusing on algorithms and business processes rather than building the hardware. 

The vision is a "hybrid cloud architecture" where an SAP business process can "offload an intractable optimization problem to a quantum computer via a seamless API call."

The demo of a truck loading scenario showed how quantum can be "interwoven" into a business process, making it "as simple as flipping a switch" for the end-user. SAP is ensuring it will be ready to embed this power into the enterprise stack as soon as it's viable.

Teched 10_The Quantum Leap

entry.title: Help future-proof your database landscape with SAP HANA Cloud
entry.content:
Teched 2025 in Berlin. It was truly a great event and great experience meeting many of you in person, SAP colleagues, SAP customers, SAP partners and all the people who attended it and all those who are interested in technology and SAP solutions. 

I had a pleasure to attend this event together with SAP HANA Cloud database team and deliver the

Help future-proof your database landscape with SAP HANA Cloud deep-dive session. Those of you who attended the session have seen how SAP HANA Cloud may become a solid data foundation for your modern business critical applications. Let us have a brief look at the highlights one more time.

SAP HANA Cloud Database as a Service

First and foremost, SAP HANA Cloud is a database as a service (DBaaS). In contrast to database systems deployed in on-premise fashion, SAP HANA Cloud offers pleasant experience, allowing to focus on the core task - application development. 

In traditional on-premise scenario there is a unquestionable need to take care of hardware maintenance and renewal cycles, on top of this there is an operating system and database maintenance that all have to be done to ensure that the system is functioning. SAP HANA Cloud is a service, it releases users from these complex and time-consuming tasks. The powerful cockpit provides information on the state of the system, users may observe and apply patches and upgrades there. The rest is managed and users become released from the maintenance tasks, having their focus kept on the application development. Refer to the operating model for SAP HANA Cloud.

 

Data tiering

SAP HANA Cloud promotes efficient data tiering options. The most critical data can be stored in memory ensuring very fast access. Important, but less frequently accessed data might be stored on disk. This is possible thanks to SAP HANA Native Storage Extension (NSE) technology. The data offloaded on disk can be accessed seamlessly without a need for writing additional SQL queries for disk and in-memory access with NSE. There are also various large data processing and archiving options - SAP HANA Data Lake Relational Engine, which allows to store petabyte scale data and access it using relational format. On top of that SAP HANA Cloud offers SAP HANA Data Lake Files - a cost efficient object store allowing to work with unstructured, semi-structured and structured data, supporting CSV, Parquet and Delta Lake formats.

 

Elastic Compute Node

Recently SAP HANA Cloud introduced Elastic Compute Node (ECN). Imagine repetitive business critical process such as quarterly report that put your database system under high load. This event occurs only few times in specific period. Oftentimes your solution would be adding (purchasing) new or extra hardware components to meet demands. But what happens for the rest of the time? This hardware remains idle, because it is active only at the quarter end, to run the report. SAP HANA Cloud allows to provision elastic compute nodes to address these on-demand needs. Once the process is completed and there is no need for additional capacity, the elastic compute nodes can be deprovisioned. And this could be managed both via SAP HANA Cloud central (UI) -  database administration tool and via API, giving the users even more flexibility.

SAP HANA Cloud - database for Business AI

SAP HANA Cloud offers various AI options to its users. It helps building AI applications utilizing knowledge graph and vector engines. It offers AI co-pilots ensuring efficient application development. In addition to this there is AI for database operations for improved automation and AI-driven insights and AI for database administrators for easier database administration thanks to conversational interfaces.

The recent addition to the SAP HANA Cloud multimodel - knowledge graph allows to derive more business context from data. While large language model interprets natural language, the knowledge graph engine adds meaning to the data. In such AI scenario various SAP HANA Cloud multi model engines (vector, spatial, text search) could be combined to ensure insightful results. The knowledge graph might be used in RAG scenarios (Retrieval Augmented Generation) where it provides context to LLMs (Large Language Model).   

SAP HANA Cloud Migration

For those who are currently running SAP HANA database on-premise, or SAP HANA as a Service (Cloud Foundry or Neo platform) and are willing to make most of the innovations with SAP HANA Cloud, there is a way to transition.

Whether you use SAP HANA as a traditional database for your custom application, or you are using full capabilities of SAP HANA Extended Service Classic or Advanced (XSC, XSA) you can migrate these and there are various options available.

SAP HANA Cloud Self-Service Migration tool

This service can be found in the SAP HANA Cloud Cockpit, and is accessible as long as you have access to SAP HANA Cloud or SAP HANA Cloud central. This service is used to migrate SAP HANA database components (SQL layer) such as tables, views, procedures and data records. It also provides downtime-optimized migration method, to keep business-critical activities running during migration. The tool migrates SAP HANA XSA service instances, which is relevant for those who have XSA-managed schemas or HDI containers. These instances will be automatically created by the Self-Service in SAP HANA Cloud Cloud Foundry space if required.

 

SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant

The SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant is an extension for the SAP BTP Business Application Studio. It allows to migrate so-called design-time artefacts (Calculation Views, CDS Views, etc) to SAP HANA Cloud CAP (Cloud Application Programming Model) or SAP HANA Cloud Native. The tool requires Business Application Studio subscription and SAP HANA version 2.0. Various supported migration scenarios displayed on the image below:

 

Both the SAP HANA Cloud Self-Service migration tool and SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant provide extensive SAP HANA migration coverage allowing to migrate SAP HANA XS applications, SAP HANA database objects and data records stored in SAP HANA databases.

Migration Services

  • Migration help desk provides technical support for any questions related only to database migrations executed with the migration self service tool for SAP HANA Cloud migrationhelpdesk@sap.com
  • SAP HANA Database Migration Factory provides a high-touch expert support for SAP HANA Cloud migrations offering free migration assessments. Fixed bid, including migration project plan from architecture planning, optimization, migration, and testing to go-live migrationfactory@sap.com
  • SAP MaxAttention Program - limited to certain customers with SAP MaxAttention program contracts. The program offers support for the migration journey from database strategy and assessments to post go-live health check.

 

Useful Links

Official Migration Product Page

SAP HANA Cloud Migration Guide

Key SAP HANA Migration topics

entry.title: SAP Build introducing intent-based development for Application Development @ SAP TechED
entry.content:
Last week was truly memorable. After a few years away, I had the privilege of attending SAP TechEd in person again, this time in Berlin. Bringing together customers, partners, and SAP colleagues under one roof‚Äîthe iconic Berlin Messe‚Äîfor three days was a unique opportunity to both share knowledge and learn from others.

The experience began on Monday with registration. Witnessing the final preparations for the show floor, I could already sense the energy and excitement that would ignite the next day.

The following morning, as I arrived and saw the long queues, I felt grateful to be part of a company that impacts so many professionals, providing a fertile environment where technology can drive meaningful business change.

TechEd day 1

My first session with Ole Lilenthal was scheduled for 12:30 PM. I quickly realized it would be presented both on-site in the main hall and broadcast live to thousands around the world.

Presenting in the main hall

Same session online

My stress level rose, but with solid preparation, I was confident in our message: ‚ÄúExtending SAP S/4HANA with SAP Build on SAP BTP has never been easier. Now, with generative AI, it‚Äôs even more accessible.‚Äù Announcing intenet-based development with SAP Build gave me the chance to introduce Vibe Coding. While many attendees were only just beginning to explore this concept, it was clear that although most had heard of generative AI‚Äôs promise, they weren‚Äôt yet familiar with its foundational pillars. We devoted significant time during and after the session to explain these concepts in depth.

 

Later that day, the keynote by Muhammad Alam, Dr. Michael Ameling, and Dr. Philip Herzig took place. Many exciting announcements centered on AI across various domains, especially SAP. An impressive on-stage demo of Vibe Coding with SAP Build by Friederike Marby showcased the dedication‚Äîthanks to Eric Solberg‚Äôs hard work‚Äîin making it a reality. These advancements set the stage perfectly for my upcoming sessions.

The evening concluded with a lively get-together in the main hall‚Äîa fitting end to the first day. Connecting with colleagues and reflecting on the day‚Äôs events helped clarify several questions and deepen our shared understanding.

The next day promised to be packed. Ole and I started again at 12:00 PM, that session focused on presenting the strategy for how AI is reshaping application development. We complemented our session with in-depth CAP demos, demonstrating how technology and AI can come together to serve real business needs.

Second session in the main hall

 

The session was so popular (see above) that a few participants approached us afterward with questions, including an ISV provider in the AI space. He shared valuable insights, noting that SAP‚Äôs innovations in application development are impressive and that many customers don‚Äôt yet realize the full extent of SAP‚Äôs capabilities. Once they do, he believes they‚Äôll unlock AI‚Äôs potential to significantly reduce development costs. I was thrilled‚Äîthis was exactly the message I hoped to convey. We exchanged details and committed to continuing the conversation with our teams.

 

In the afternoon, my next session was with Tim Back: an in-depth exploration of ‚ÄúSAP Joule for Developers: How AI Can Boost Your Development in SAP Build.‚Äù Tim delivered a comprehensive demo of both Joule for developers and new intent-based development features in SAP Build Web Studio, highlighting the latest Vibe Coding capabilities.

Tim and I just before session started

I opened the session by emphasizing that while this isn‚Äôt yet a bulletproof generative AI process, SAP is striving to make it Relevant, Reliable, and Responsible.

The day wrapped up with a celebratory dinner alongside all the SAP Build PMs‚Äîa wonderful way to mark the event‚Äôs success!

The final day focused on tying up loose ends and attending sessions led by colleagues. All in all, I had the incredible opportunity to attend SAP TechEd as a speaker. I‚Äôm truly grateful for the experience and already looking forward to the next one. Participating as a presenter at one of the premier technology conferences in the SAP ecosystem was both an honor and a challenge, leaving me inspired, enriched, and deeply connected to the community.

If you would like to try out our new SAP Build Joule for Developer together with some vibe coding capabilities, don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out to me.     

Here are some links in case you would like to watch the sessions:

  • Future of Application Development in SAP Build
  • A shift towards AI-assisted developer-centric tool in SAP Build

Thank you, SAP TechEd, for an unforgettable experience. See you at the next event!

entry.title: Agentic Databases for Data Scientists: SAP HANA Cloud Will Equip You with a Team
entry.content:
During my tenure as a data practitioner, I often preferred my own database to produce mission-critical calculations. The journey of such an analysis usually began with a single purpose, like informing a business process manager or a change of parameters to optimize a back-end process. Regardless of the original scope, the need to operationalize the logic often followed.

data professional in front of two monitors

Moonlighting as a DBA was nice, admittedly, because I could manage my databases with minimal process obstacles . However, the time lost searching documentation and stuck in trial-error loops of administrative commands only increased the delivery pressure, as deadlines are often unforgiving. I very quickly learned that while I was certainly capable of performing a dual role, I could not be great at both. The expectations of my job demanded data analysis excellence, while I desperately sought after administrative competency.

Last week at SAP TechEd 2025, the SAP HANA Cloud team made a few significant announcements. One very notable set of features is the introduction of the agentic database concept. Simply illustrated and grounded in my scenario, the use of AI agents could give me the best of both worlds ‚Äì autonomy and scale. Applying the example, imagine the productivity benefits associated with giving every data science professional a dedicated team of agentic colleagues ‚Äì administrator, data analyst, and a multi-model specialist.

SAP HANA Cloud agents

For those who prefer the native use of a database, consider the upcoming agentic features of SAP HANA Cloud:

  • The discovery agent provides insight into the objects within the database using a knowledge graph for more efficient semantic lookups.
  • The multi-model agent augments with the specialist knowledge needed to use the advanced analysis engines.
  • The data agent supplements the need for SQL with natural language queries.
  • The admin agent assists with the analysis and optimization of the database.

SAP HANA Cloud enhances all data professionals with agentic teammates. Thanks additionally to in-memory speed, machine learning and AI libraries, access to multi-model engines, data-tiering, and the ability to scale, this cloud database provides the much-desired resources to build autonomous, intelligent, and responsive solutions that drive business process excellence.

To learn more about functionality and availability ...

(1) Be sure to watch these TechEd 2025 virtual session replays:

SAP HANA Cloud: The Database for Business AI

Accelerating Your AI Strategy with SAP HANA Cloud

 What‚Äôs Next for SAP HANA Cloud: Road Map and Innovation Highlights

(2) Make sure to read these blogs:

SAP HANA Cloud Becomes Agentic: Introducing Discovery Agent & Data Agent

What‚Äôs Next with SAP HANA Cloud ‚Äì SAP TechEd 2025

Unleashing the Power of Trusted Data: SAP 2025 TechEd Announces Enhanced Data Product Capabilities

(3) Sign up for the free SAP HANA Cloud basic trial for a hands-on experience that includes a tutorial of the multi-model and data science capabilities of the database.

entry.title: IntelliFlow Manufacturing with SAP S/4HANA UX and Collaboration Manager
entry.content:
*********************** Updated as per 2508 release *******************************

In the ever-changing field of digital manufacturing, SAP continues to push the boundaries of innovation with its new release, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Among the noteworthy features is the Review Progress Order‚ÄîMultilevel View App, a game-changing tool for improving visibility, control, and cooperation across production and procurement processes. This strong pair, together with the newly released SAP Collaboration Manager, is redefining real-time communication and job execution for industrial teams.

Introducing the Review Progress Order app.
Manufacturing procedures are complicated, with many levels of connections, components, and timelines. The Review Progress Order App handles this complexity by providing a multi-level view of production, sales, and processing orders.

It allows users to

  •   Visualize component needs and receipt aspects throughout an order structure.
    ‚Ä¢ Identify and analyze component shortages and delays to determine their root causes.
    ‚Ä¢ Calculate total order delays depending on delivery and production time.
    ‚Ä¢ Easily access associated apps, such as Manage Material Coverage, Display Material Stock, and Change Planned Order.
    ‚Ä¢ Export data to Excel for offline analysis and reporting.

Why It Matters
Manufacturers frequently suffer with fragmented data and delayed insights. The Review Progress Order App combines crucial information into a single, simple interface. It enables planners and production managers to make educated decisions more rapidly, minimizing bottlenecks and boosting on-time delivery performance.
Collaboration Manager: A New Era of In-App Communication.
SAP has officially decommissioned the SAP CoPilot and introduced the SAP Collaboration Manager as a replacement for human-to-human collaboration within the SAP Fiori Launchpad. This innovation is currently available in both SAP S/4HANA Cloud and on-premise editions, providing a contextual, real-time communication layer directly within business applications

Key Features of Collaboration Manager:
‚Ä¢ Set up individual or group discussions based on specific screens or business objects.
‚Ä¢ Include attachments, screenshots, and video links in chats.
‚Ä¢ Edit or remove messages quickly after posting.
‚Ä¢ Convert private notes into collaborative threads as needed.
‚Ä¢ Go straight to the screenshot or chat screen.
‚Ä¢ Receive quick notifications for prompt answers and task completion
Collaboration in the Manufacturing Context

Let's see a demo to understand it more clearly. 

To set the context, let's assume a sales representative has received a call from a customer about the delay of their order. The sales representative then contacts the production team to inquire about the delay.  Assume a production planner uses the Review Progress Order App to detect a delay in a vital component. Rather than switching systems or exchanging emails, users may start a discussion with the procurement team right away using Collaboration Manager. The discussion contains screenshots, order information, and direct links to the affected components. This in-house collaboration eliminates delays, improves clarity, and speeds up problem solving.

Here in the demo, one of the customers contacted the sales representative, Dale Jones, who was asking for confirmation on the delayed sales order delivery. The sales representative sent a message through Collaboration Manager to the material planner or production planner regarding this matter. Here, the material planner, Michelle, replied with "acknowledge the message" by clicking on the sent icon to the sales representative through the Collaboration Manager.


Fig 1 : In App communication - Collaboration Manager

 

Fig 2 : Collaboration Manager - Acknowledgement

Then Michelle clicks on the "Review Order Progress" app in the Favorites section. After providing the sales order number in the app, she finds the Issues column and finds two issues are present‚Äîone of the required components has an uncovered quantity of 3 pieces for a planned product order. In this case, ‚ÄúPldOrd 4000002986.‚Äù The other one has a total delay of 1 day for the 10 pieces coming via a purchase requisition. In this case, ‚ÄúPurRqs 3000002513-10.‚Äù

Fig 3 : Review Progress Order app

 

Fig 4: in app option to navigate

The app, "Manage Material Coverage" option‚ÄîManage the material coverage to resolve this issue. The "Reschedule" option for the Purchase Requisition provides a summary of the material coverage for this component, indicating that we are short by 10 pieces and need them within 9 days. The stock/requirements list provides an overview of what is coming in and going out when: Aug 12th I need 10 pieces, but I will be 10 short then.


Fig 5: Resolving issue

The system automatically proposes the new delivery date. It is now up to the user to accept it or reject it for an earlier or later date.

Fig 6 : Issue shown

Here, the coverage issue for the material can be viewed.

Fig 7: In house navigation

 

Fig 8: Resolving issue via Manage Monitor Coverage

 

Fig 9: Issue Resolve

All the issues are now resolved.
The Review Order Progress application makes it easy to obtain an overview of any issues an order may have and also makes it easy to resolve them.

Fig 10: Collaboration Manager - communication

 

Customer Benefits: Synergy of UX and Intelligence
The combination of the Review Progress Order App and Collaboration Manager provides a comprehensive user experience that combines data transparency and real-time collaboration. This is how customers benefit:
1. Improved Decision-Making
With multilayer visibility of order progress and component delays, users can solve issues before they escalate. The ability to export data and navigate to connected apps ensures that decisions are based on thorough information.
2. Improved operational efficiency.
Collaboration Manager improves workflow efficiency by eliminating the need for external communication tools and enabling contextual discussions. Teams spend less time searching for information and more time carrying out tasks.
3. Faster issue resolution.
Real-time notifications and interactive threads help cross-functional teams address problems rapidly. The system immediately notifies the appropriate persons of any shortage, delay, or procurement problem.
4. User-Centric Design.
Both tools are based on SAP Fiori, which ensures a uniform and straightforward user experience. The interface is dynamic, role-based, and geared for productivity, whether used on a desktop or a mobile device.
5. Scalability & Integration
These elements are part of SAP's overall vision for building an intelligent, sustainable organization. They readily interact with other SAP apps and modules, allowing for scalability across sectors and geographies.

Conclusion: A New Standard for Manufacturing Excellence.
SAP's most recent developments in S/4HANA are more than just feature enhancements; they represent a paradigm shift in how industrial firms function. The Review Progress Order App clarifies complex order structures, and the Collaboration Manager encourages agile, informed teamwork.
They represent a strong blend of UX and enterprise intelligence, allowing businesses to respond faster, collaborate smarter, and provide better results. For consumers, their use implies more production, lower costs, and higher satisfaction‚Äîall hallmarks of a really intelligent manufacturing organization.

entry.title: Get Ready for these Community Talks at SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore 2025
entry.content:
Example of a Community Talk which took place at SAP TechEd in Berlin 2025

It is time to get ready for an engaging series of Community Talk sessions that bring together SAP experts and enthusiasts for an exchange of insights, innovations, and best practices. Here's an overview of what's in store at this year's SAP TechEd on Tour stop in Bangalore, India:  

November 25, 2025

  1. CT1000 | Building the SAP Community Escape House
    Time: 11:30 AM - 11:50 AM
    Discover how SAP CAP and server-side rendering bring the Community Escape House to life, featuring custom authentication and live coding.
    Speaker: Nico Schoenteich, SAP Developer Advocate, SAP

  2. CT1001 | Designing Real-Time Core Extensions with SAP Build Process Automation
    Time: 12:00 PM - 12:20 PM
    Explore scalable automation solutions on SAP BTP for process visibility and continuous improvement.
    Speaker: Mohit Bansal, SAP BTP Solution Architect, Infosys

  3. CT1010 | Joule for Developer for UCB Pharma
    Time: 12:30 PM - 12:50 PM
    Discover how Joule enhances developer productivity and application intelligence.
    Speaker: Ravi Grover, SAP Solution Architect, IBM

  4. CT1003 | Empowering Organizations through Situation Handling in SAP S/4HANA
    Time: 1:00 PM - 1:20 PM
    Discover transformative approaches to managing exceptions and fostering collaboration.
    Speakers: Karan Bahl, Senior Solution Architect, EY GDS & Ranjeet Kumar, Solution Architect, EY GDS

  5. CT1006 | From Rookie to SAP Champion - Learn, Certify, Lead Your SAP Career
    Time: 1:30 PM - 1:50 PM
    Learn how SAP certifications and learning journeys can elevate your career.
    Speaker: Kunal Bansal, SAP Champion, Solution Architect, IBM

  6. CT1007 | Get the Scoop on SAP Certifications
    Time: 2:00 PM - 2:20 PM
    Discover the roadmap to skills recognition through SAP Certification.
    Speaker: Timo Schuette, VP Product & Solution Learning, SAP

  7. CT1009 | Himalaya‚Äôs Digital Integration Journey with SAP Integration Suite
    Time: 2:30 PM - 2:50 PM
    Gain insights into modernizing integration landscapes with SAP Integration Suite.
    Speaker: Shaik Azmathulla, Integration Architect, Himalaya Wellness Company

  8. CT1012 | Leveraging Translation Hub for Efficient ABAP UI Text Localization
    Time: 3:00 PM - 3:20 PM
    Discover text localization techniques for SAP Fiori and classic UIs.
    Speaker: Vara Prasad Thatikonda & Omar Misbah, Solution Architects, Daimler Truck

  9. CT1013 | Revolutionize SAP Security Management with Agentic AI
    Time: 3:30 PM - 3:50 PM
    Explore AI-driven transformation of SAP security management.
    Speaker: Vidyut Dinkar Kichambare, SAP Architecture and Basis Solutions Delivery Lead, Canpack

  10. CT1018 | Trivia Competition
    Time: 4:00 PM - 4:20 PM
    Test your SAP knowledge through fun trivia.
    Speaker: Daniel Wroblewski & Shrinivasan Neelamegam, SAP Developer Advocates, SAP

  11. CT1020 | What is the SAP Community
    Time: 4:30 PM - 4:50 PM
    Get an overview of SAP Community‚Äôs role and offerings.
    Speaker: Laura Schmitz, SAP Community Advocate, SAP 

November 26, 2025

  1. CT1004 | Empowering Organizations through Situation Handling in SAP S/4HANA
    Time: 11:00 AM - 11:20 AM
    Discover transformative approaches to managing exceptions and fostering collaboration.
    Speakers: Karan Bahl, Senior Solution Architect, EY GDS & Ranjeet Kumar, Solution Architect, EY GDS

  2. CT1008 | Get the Scoop on SAP Certifications
    Time: 11:30 AM - 11:50 AM
    Discover the roadmap to skills recognition through SAP Certification.
    Speaker: Timo Schuette, VP Product & Solution Learning, SAP

  3. CT1002 | Driving Business Innovation with SAP's Generative AI Hub & Joule Agents
    Time: 12:00 PM - 12:20 PM
    Learn how SAP‚Äôs generative AI transforms workflows and decision-making through agentic AI.
    Speaker: Sidharth Gupta, Product Learning Expert, SAP

  4. CT1014 | SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management
    Time: 1:00 PM - 1:20 PM
    Streamline invoice processing with SAP Ariba on SAP BTP.
    Speaker: Ayyappagari Sreekanth, Technical Architect, hcl Technology

  5. CT1011 | Langchain Integration with SAP HANA Cloud
    Time: 1:30 PM - 1:50 PM
    Learn how SAP HANA Cloud integrates with LangChain to make use of vector search, knowledge graph, and further in-database capabilities as part of AI-based applications.
    Speaker: Witalij Rudnicki, SAP Developer Advocate, SAP

  6. CT1016 | Side-by-Side Extensibility with BTP, ABAP, and S/4HANA Cloud
    Time: 2:00 PM - 2:20 PM
    Discover service consumption models for integrated SAP environments.
    Speaker: Shilpa Shankar, SAP Developer Advocate, SAP

  7. CT1017 | Simplify UI App Hosting with Application FrontEnd Service
    Time: 2:30 PM - 2:50 PM
    Learn to efficiently deploy UI applications on SAP BTP.
    Speaker: Shrinivasan Neelamegam, SAP Developer Advocate, SAP

  8. CT1019 | Trivia Competition
    Time: 3:00 PM - 3:20 PM
    Test your SAP knowledge through fun trivia.
    Speaker: Daniel Wroblewski & Shrinivasan Neelamegam, SAP Developer Advocates, SAP

  9. CT1021 | What is the SAP Community
    Time: 3:30 PM - 3:50 PM
    Get an overview of SAP Community‚Äôs role and offerings.
    Speaker: Anne K Petteroe, SAP Community Advocate, SAP

  10. CT1022 | Why ABAP Developers Are Thriving in the AI Era
    Time: 4:00 PM - 4:20 PM
    Learn how AI tools are enhancing productivity in ABAP development.
    Speaker: Rich Heilman, SAP Developer Advocate, SAP

To register, simply search for the respective session ID in the session catalog or browse all Community Talks by filtering for the session type ‚ÄúCommunity Talks‚Äù.

Join us at the Community Theatre for these insightful sessions during SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore, November 25-26, 2025 and make the most of your visit!

See you there!

entry.title: TechEd 2025 in Berlin - Recap on planning in SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
It has already been a week since I boarded my train home from Berlin after an exciting TechEd 2025. Coming back from such an event always feels a bit like returning to reality ‚Äî all the nicer to look back on the sessions I had the honor of hosting and the great conversations with customers and partners in the meeting center, at the demo booth, and beyond. 

In case you missed TechEd, don't worry. We have got you covered. 

Virtual Sessions:

Together with @jie_deng  and @matthiaskraemer, I hosted session DA207 - Planning and analytics: Innovations powering SAP Business Data Cloud which is available on-demand on the TechEd virtual website (registration required). We had a full house, lots of interesting questions and loads of live demos (and no demo system let us down üôè). We discussed the overall strategy of SAP Analytics Cloud in the context of SAP Business Data Cloud. On the planning side, we gave an outlook on our priorities for 2026 and highlighted recent innovations in seamless planning and GenAI. We could also showcase great new features like MyMetrics, Horizon theme support and provided a labs preview at how we want to further empower the story designer in SAP Analytics Cloud. 

Besides, I recommend these sessions (again, registration is required):

Session ID & NameSpeakersLink
ST107v | SAP Business Data Cloud: Strategy, architecture, and visionTorsten Ammon
SVP - Head of Business Data Cloud Core 
Prakash Nanduri
Global Head of Product Management BDC&I
Link
DA806v | SAP Business Data Cloud solution road mapTorsten Ammon
SVP - Head of Business Data Cloud Core 
Kristian R√ºmmelin
SAP Business Data Cloud - Head of Product Management Planning & Analytics,		Link
DA203v | SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business WarehouseDominik Kurz
Product Expert SAP BW/4HANA & SAP BW Bridge
Klaus-Peter Sauer
Product Management SAP Business Data Cloud		 Link
Hands-on

Our hands-on workshop DA267 - Seamless planning for xP&A in SAP Business Data Cloud (SAP BDC) was another highlight. Preparing such sessions is a big task but it always is worth the effort. Luckily, I was supported by @jie_deng and @Matthew_Shaw who supported the preparation, the testing, and the session itself. The new live version feature for seamless planning was front and center in the workshop. Participants learned how to:

  • Build a seamless planning model from a view that is part of content shipped with Working Capital Insights Intelligent Application
  • Expose plan data in SAP Datasphere and bring it together with actual data in an analytic model
  • Extend the model with xP&A data and leverage the live version for calculations

The exercise and the tenants are still available! Check it out!

Exercise flow

Thanks to everyone for joining TechEd and for your interest in our content! Looking forward to 2026 already.

entry.title: SAP Developer News 13th November 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION

Field report from SAP TechEd on Tour in Sydney 

  • SAP TechEd home https://www.sap.com/events/teched.html  

SAP BTP, ABAP environment ‚Äì Customer & Partner Roundtable 19 Nov 

  • Blog post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/customer-amp-partner-roundtable-for-sap-btp-abap-environment-29-demo-time/ba-p/14263936  

ABAP Development Tools for VS Code: Everything You Need to Know 

  • Blog post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/abap-development-tools-for-vs-code-everything-you-need-to-know/ba-p/14258129 

Introducing the Next Era of ABAP Development 

  • Blog post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/introducing-the-next-era-of-abap-development/ba-p/14260522 

SAP Open Source Webinar on open-sourced MCP servers 19 Nov 

  • Webinar details page (incl. registration) https://events.sap.com/open-sourced-mcp-servers-supporting-btp-platform-developers/en_us/home.html  

CHAPTER TITLES

0:00 Intro 

0:07 Field report from SAP TechEd on Tour in Sydney 

1:32 SAP BTP, ABAP Environment: Customer and Partner Roundtable 19 Nov 

2:01 ABAP Development Tools for VS Code: Everything You Need to Know 

3:19 Introducing the Next Era of ABAP Development  

3:54 SAP Open Source Webinar on open-sourced MCP servers 19 Nov 

TRANSCRIPT

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for November 13th, 2025.

[Tom] Hey, everyone. We're coming to you from Sydney, Australia. This is our first stop on TechEd on Tour. We got some of the team that's here in Australia. Say hi, everyone. Hi. We'll be doing hands-on sessions from the event as well as the developer garage. We're here in the developer garage on the show floor. There's Anne. Josh, what do we have planned from the community side? So we've got a lovely community corner here as we're calling it. We're actually asked the people how they like to navigate our Community website, as well as just the outreach. Having a meetup last night, a Stammtisch. We've got to keep doing that. Once I get on tour, we've got a couple more spots for me to go into. Having a lot of fun meeting with people in person. Yeah, it's been great energy. The Stammtisch last night, what would you say, 70, 80 people there or so? a good turnout and uh we're all this is our second week on the road uh for for many of us we'll be heading to uh Melbourne and uh Singapore next week for some CodeJams and then on to Bangalore for the last stop for the TechEd on Tour so uh continue to tune in to the SAP Developer News for updates on what's going on with the TechEd on Tour and if you're in any of those cities we're coming to, we're looking forward to seeing you in the coming weeks. Until then, have fun, everybody. Bye.

[Riley] Howdy, developers. If you're interested in ABAP, there's a customer and partner roundtable session scheduled for next week. It's happening on November the 19th. The ABAP product team will be going over several new features related to the release of 2511. They'll also be going over new ADT features as well. A Q&A session will follow. You can find details in Iwona Hahn's blog post, which is linked to below. Thank you.

[Mamikee] As we heard at TechEd Berlin 2025, we're rolling out ABAP Development Tools for VS Code. Here's what's in the scoop now and where to read more. From ABAP Development Tools for VS Code, Everything You Need to Know blog post, The first wave targets ABAP Cloud only, not dynpro or web dynpro, and starts with RAP UI services so front-end and back-end RAP can work and live in one place. It's an early adopter drop with roughly a dozen plus object types and the core develop-test-debug loop. Now for work outside of RAP UI services, keep Eclipse ADT in the mix for now. We'll catch up to Eclipse one client release at a time. We're reusing the ADT code base and moving tool to the LSP. Editing is file-based, which is great for today's AI workflows, and Joule for Developers is planned for VS Code. You can also use VS Code's AI extension. Just note, the virtual workspace model means some extensions may have limits. Now, backend support aligns with Eclipse down to SAP NetWeaver 7.3. From the Introducing the Next Era of ABAP Development blog post, this puts VS Code inside the broader direction, modern tooling, plus AI-assisted development to boost productivity and make ABAP development feel at home with today's workflow. This post is the strategy view where the experience is heading and how AI features like Joule for Developers will evolve alongside the tooling. Now, you can read both of these blog posts in the link below.

[DJ] If you took part in Devtoberfest or caught some of the SAP TechEd content this year, then you may already be aware of SAP's adoption of the open Model Context Protocol, MCP, and the birth of open -source-based MCP servers for CAP, UI5, and Fiori development. Now is the perfect time to dig in and learn more and you're in luck because there's an SAP open source webinar on this very topic covering the three MCP servers I've just mentioned it's next week on Wednesday the 19th of November. There are three awesome big-brained experts David Kunz, Dominik Heim and Matthias Osswald and the webinar will cover the protocol itself and how these MCP servers can help. There'll be a live demo too, and you'll have a chance to ask questions. And it's free. Head over to the SAP Open Source webinars page to register. Link in the description.
